text: hey everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's most
apathetic music nerd and my throat hurts
today but I don't care don't care I'm
here so apathetic at this point that I
don't really care about album reviews I
don't care how this dude is well I
empathy is a a wrapper for a connect I
can connect Ike how dough hurts I'm from
Connecticut you can't even see where we
live right gonna get a ticket
couch esta is right apathy is a
Connecticut wrapper and this is his
third LP it's titled honky Kong and if
that wasn't enough of a hint he's white
like me
this guy's career goes way back back to
the 90s back to 1997 where his first
feature was on the first Jedi Mind
Tricks album and digging through this
dude's past was a little bit of a
nostalgia trip for me just kind of
reminding me of a lot of hip-hop that I
used to listen to in the early 2000s 7l
and esoteric Lewis logic and this crew
that apathy runs with the demigods and
over the course of his career apathy has
been kind of like a snowball just
rolling down this hill and picking up
friends connections features and all of
them come together and help him make
this album what it is longtime allies
show up on this album like self-titled
and ill bill and Vinnie Paz who actually
have a new collaborative album out and
even more people come out of the
woodwork for an eighth feature posse
track toward the end of the album this
dudes momentum has gotten so huge that
there's even a feature with exhibit on
this album another hot commodity from
New York right now Action Bronson is
even on a track and DJ premier produces
a beat for this guy as far as the beats
go on this LP it shoots for kind of a
classic boom bap style but with a more
updated feel it's definitely not as
gritty as things used to be in the 90s
bored but this album still shoots for
some
thing really straightforward and raw
there's some great moments where guitars
are sampled on this album
I love the horns and sinister strings
that show up on the opening track honky
Kong and I think my favorite sample on
the entire album are the really low evil
villainous vocals chopped and looped on
the song the villain of course there's
DJ scratches all over a lot of these
tracks and there are some moments like
on the recipe where this album gets kind
of a little more electronic in the beats
but it doesn't get soft in the process
makes that transition pretty smoothly of
course there are tracks on here to where
you're gonna catch funk and soul samples
overall it's not really anything all
that inventive to be honest the beats do
the job you know overall what really
makes this album for me are the lyrics
apathy so on this thing doesn't really
come off really intricate technical or
flashy he makes up for that by being
really consistent and real and bringing
a lot of charisma to the table he's
always very articulate and clear and
vivid with the imagery that he's putting
together whether he's being aggressive
funny or like emotional they're a good
chunk of like braggadocious tracks on
here some of them sink and some of them
float the first track comes on really
hard just like a first track on an album
like this should and app these laying
down these hilarious lyrics about the
kind of people that come out of the
woodwork for music like this and he's
rapping about girls with stretch marks
and love handles and no money who swear
they're like playboy bunnies but tracks
like fear itself or albino gorillas or
even Never Say Never
the hooks get pretty bad and the beats
are just okay and the lyrics just aren't
great enough to save the song you know
where this album really shines are on
the more conceptual tracks that are more
lyrical or have a narrative thankfully
that's most of the tracks here I love
the track of the villain where basically
the whole theme is to just talk about
villainous things politicians pedophiles
demons pollution and I love the apathy
can have a guest emcee on that track and
they link up with the concept of the
song
and actually carry it out collaboration
check to check is about being broke as
hell and I love the Outkast sample on
that song the recipe with exhibit is
great where most of the lyrics are
acronyms it's only hip hop is a
fantastic song about pretty much fans
being a little crazy a little obsessive
and pretty much apathy coming out and
saying look I'm just a person you're
making a pretty big deal out of this
and that's not something that you know
over a great beat with some great lyrics
you usually hear a rapper say I haven't
heard it done to this extent since like
that Eminem song Stan I dedicate this to
you is a love song that pretty much goes
off without any hitches it gets a little
corny but it does the job but the song
that was nearest and dearest to my heart
was peace Connecticut a straight up rap
song about Connecticut and it's really
something anyone and everyone from
Connecticut should hear from calling
Willimantic Connecticut heroin town
rapping about grinders north face
jackets good old Tom it should make
anybody who lives in this state feel a
little bit of CT pride there are some
moments on this LP in the lyricism in
the beats where this feels like you know
a typical rap album it feels very
typical of hip-hop but thankfully apathy
has great taste and beats a really
strong personality and enough lyricism
to make this album feel like more than
that as a whole you can call me CT
biased that's fine but I don't think
this dude would be attracting the kind
of features and the attention that he is
if this was just a Connecticut thing I'm
feeling a light too decent seven on this
liked it a lot I wish it it ventured
more I wish it experimented a little bit
more but apathy is more of a guy who
brings it straight from the gut doesn't
take himself too seriously and comes
with a lot of energy if you've heard
this LP let me know what you think love
it hate it why and what should I review
next anthony Fantana apathy honky Kong
forever
